What is this service?

This service provides a wrapper around the DataCite Metadata Store for members of {{organisation_name}}. The DataCite Metadata Store is a service for data publishers to mint DOIs and register associated metadata. This service requires users to first register for an account with a {{organisation_name}} DataCite representative {{organisation_email}} . Once registered, a user will be able to use their federal id to mint DOIs. For information about DataCite and DOIs, see their Frequently asked questions.

Who can use this service?

This service is aimed at scientific and research data publishers.

I have datasets and want to mint DOIs! How can I use this service?

There are two steps. Firstly, you will need to register with our service. Please contact a {{organisation_name}} DataCite representative who will get in touch with you to discuss your eligibility, requirements and responsibilities. If you qualify, they will provide you with the necessary information.

Secondly, you will need to use the DataCite application programming interface (API) to mint DOIs. It is recommended that you integrate minting and updating DOIs with your metadata management infrastructure. So if, for example, a URL changes, automatic notification will be pushed to our service and the updated URL will be used for resolving the DOI.

How can I contact you?

To set up an account please contact {{organisation_email}}.
